to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: It is actually reflection of this view that she cruelly kept down the Movement of 1898.
sentences.chinese: 她残酷地镇压戊戌变法运动就是这一基本思想的反映。

sentences.english: The fifth part analyses the impact of Wang Anshi's personality characteristics over the political reform' success and failure.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分分析了王安石的个性特征对变法成败的影响。

sentences.english: Liang, once a student of Kang's, helped Kang by writing articles propagating reformist ideas.
sentences.chinese: 康有为的学生梁启超协助撰写文章，宣传变法思想。

sentences.english: He inspired Chinese scholars with his writings and reform movements.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章和变法运动激励著一代代中国学者。

sentences.english: The first item of his political reform is to reorganize the breakdown of law and order.
sentences.chinese: 他变法的第一项内容就是要整顿陵替的法制。

sentences.english: The composition ratios of inclusion compounds were obtained by the continuous variation method.
sentences.chinese: 用连续递变法测定了包合物的组成摩尔比。

sentences.english: Wang Anshi's theory of "New Learning" served as his theoretical basis in introducing the "New Laws".
sentences.chinese: “荆公新学”是王安石变法的理论基础。

sentences.english: The Reform Movement of 1898 is a revolutionary movement of bourgeois nature.
sentences.chinese: 戊戌变法是一次资产阶级性质的革命运动。

definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty

lit. rich country, strong army (idiom); slogan of legalist philosophers in pre-Han times/Make the country wealthy and the military powerful, slogan of modernizers in Qing China and Meiji Japan (Japanese pronunciation: Fukoku kyōhei)

failed reform of Northern Song government in 1043

Shang Yang (c. 390-338 BC), legalist philosopher and statesman of the state of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], whose reforms paved the way for the eventual unification of the Chinese empire by the Qin dynasty 秦朝|秦朝[Qin2 chao2]

Shen Buhai (385-337 BC), legalist political thinker

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
